term.title: relative

item.text: Quotient of quantities having the same kind-of-quantity in different systems.

notes.item: The denominator quantity is often called the reference quantity.
Preferentially the same component is found in the numerator and denominator quantity.

sources.item: PAC, 1996, 68, 957. 'Glossary of terms in quantities and units in Clinical Chemistry (IUPAC-IFCC Recommendations 1996)' on page 989 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199668040957)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
